title: Improving PBL-Based Mathematics Instructional Design Through Analysis of Remote Education Interaction Patterns

context.prior_knowledge: Basic proficiency in digital tools and secondary-level mathematics knowledge
context.additional_context: Development of effective interaction strategies to overcome spatial/temporal constraints for professionals (medical/legal/technical)

learning_goals: Learners can systematically classify interaction patterns between teachers and learners in remote education environments using three or more analytical tools
Based on analysis results, learners can explain the correlation between interaction frequency and learning outcomes in PBL math classes with 80% accuracy
Learners can design at least two customized instructional strategies that minimize time/space constraints using interaction data
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
